intro: Racosperma wardellii, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wattled acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has small, cylindrical pods that contain seeds, typical of the Acacia genus. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Racosperma wardellii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
